final_answer:
The humor and satire in the image stem from the juxtaposition of procedures. In the first panel, rubbing alcohol is used to clean the arm, a standard and sterile practice before giving an injection. This process is typically associated with ensuring safety and preventing infection.

However, the second panel reveals that the syringe is labeled "lethal injection," implying the injection is intended to be fatal. The use of rubbing alcohol in this context becomes nonsensical and ironic—it highlights the absurdity of taking care to prevent infection when the ultimate goal is death. This contradiction forms the basis of the humor and satirical commentary on medical practices.
